text: Timothy John Leigh Bell, Baron Bell (18 October 1941 – 25 August 2019), was a British advertising and public relations executive. He was best known for his role as an adviser in Margaret Thatcher's three successful general election campaigns. He was also known for co-founding and 30 years of heading Bell Pottinger. ==Controversy== He had exposed himself while masturbating at his Hampstead bathroom window on 21 October in full view of female passers-by.Mark Hollingsworth The Ultimate spin doctor: the life and fast times of Tim Bell, London: Hodder & Stoughton, 1997, p.45 He was later convicted as a sex offender.Brian Basham "Thatcher exposed in Tim Bell revelations", Marketing Week, 14 March 1997 ==Death== Bell died on 25 August 2019 at the age of 77.Tim Bell, Margaret Thatcher’s spin doctor, dies at 77 ==Styles of address== *1941–1991: Mr Timothy Bell *1991–1998: Sir Timothy Bell *1998–: The Right Honourable The Lord Bell ==References== ==Other websites== *Lukashenko's PR man sheds light on EU campaign EU Observer, 10 October 2008 *Can Lord Bell’s PR skills combat the aroma of communism and cabbage?
